raw_text:
Casino Royale is next Bond movie
 
 Casino Royale, author Ian Fleming's first James Bond book, is to be the next Bond film, with Goldeneye director Martin Campbell behind the camera.
 
 It will be the 21st James Bond film to hit the big screen, and speculation has been rife over who will play the lead. Casino Royale was turned into a spoof spy movie by John Huston in 1967, with David Niven in the lead role. Pierce Brosnan led the past four Bond films but said producers axed him after offering him the chance to return. Among the favourites to take over the coveted role are Scottish actor Dougray Scott, Oscar nominee Clive Owen and Australian star Hugh Jackman. Producers say no decision has yet been made on who will become the seventh actor, including Niven, to play Bond on film. Kill Bill director Quentin Tarantino had talked of wanting to take on the Casino Royale project, and said he had spoken to Brosnan about it.
 
 Shooting on Casino Royale is expected to begin once Campbell has finished work on The Legend of Zorro, a sequel to The Mask of Zorro, starring Catherine Zeta Jones and Antonio Banderas. Producers Barbara Broccoli and Michael G Wilson expect the film to be released in 2006.
 
 The script will once again be developed by Neal Purvis and Robert Wade who have both worked on two previous Bond movies. Fleming's book saw the introduction of Bond pitted against a Russian spy in a game of baccarat. Simultaneously, a woman arrives on the scene to take his eye off the game. The novel is one of Fleming's most violent and sadistic stories, with 007 suffering a savage beating from his nemesis Le Chiffre. In addition to the 1967 film, it was also adapted for television in 1954 with actor Barry Nelson as an Americanised "Jimmy" Bond. MGM Vice Chairman Chris McGurk said: "Martin (Campbell) is an incredibly exciting film-maker. Goldeneye was a wonderful movie and helped reinvigorate the Bond franchise. We're thrilled to have him back to direct the newest Bond." New Zealand-born Campbell moved to the UK in 1966 and directed TV series such as The Professionals, Minder and Bergerac. His film credits include Edge of Darkness, Vertical Limit and Beyond Borders, which starred Angelina Jolie and Clive Owen.
llama3.2:1b: The next James Bond movie is Casino Royale, written by Ian Fleming and based on his first book. Martin Campbell will direct the film, with speculation surrounding who will play Bond. Pierce Brosnan has been mentioned as a possible lead, while other actors such as Dougray Scott, Clive Owen, and Hugh Jackman have also been suggested. Shooting is expected to begin after The Legend of Zorro, and it is projected to be released in 2006.
llama3.2:3b: Casino Royale, Ian Fleming's first James Bond book, will be the next Bond film with Martin Campbell directing. Shooting is expected to begin once Campbell finishes work on The Legend of Zorro, starring Catherine Zeta Jones and Antonio Banderas, and producers expect a 2006 release. The script will be developed by Neal Purvis and Robert Wade, who have worked on previous Bond movies.
gemma2:2b: Casino Royale, Ian Fleming's first James Bond novel, will be adapted into a new movie with Martin Campbell directing.  The 21st Bond film is expected to star an unknown actor chosen from Dougray Scott, Clive Owen, and Hugh Jackman. Shooting is anticipated to begin after Campbell finishes work on The Legend of Zorro. Release date is set for 2006. Neal Purvis and Robert Wade are writing the script based on the original novel's story of Bond's confrontation with a Russian spy in baccarat.  Martin Campbell directed Goldeneye, one of the most popular Bond films.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Ian Fleming's James Bond series will be revived with a new film set in the 1960s. Martin Campbell is directing Goldeneye, a sequel to Casino Royale. The novel features a game of baccarat between a Russian spy and 007, featuring a female character on the scene to distract him. The script was developed by Neal Purvis and Robert Wade. Fleming's "Zero" series was the most violent and sadistic of his stories, with 007 beaten and tortured. The 21st James Bond film is expected to be released in 2006.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Casino Royale, Ian Fleming's first James Bond book turned into a film starring Pierce Brosnan, is set for release in 2006 under Martin Campbell as director after Goldeneye. The film marks the 21st entry in the James Bond series, with speculation about who will take over the lead role from Brosnan.
qwen2.5:3b: Casino Royale, Ian Fleming's first Bond book, is set to be the next James Bond film with Martin Campbell directing. Pierce Brosnan will not return as 007; potential leads include Dougray Scott, Clive Owen, and Hugh Jackman. The novel features Bond competing in baccarat against a Russian spy, resulting in a savage beating from his antagonist. Martin Campbell previously directed Goldeneye and is set to direct the new film after finishing work on The Legend of Zorro. Barbara Broccoli and Michael G Wilson expect it to be released in 2006. Neal Purvis and Robert Wade will develop the script, which draws inspiration from Fleming's violent and sadistic novel.

The script for Casino Royale is expected to be developed by Neal Purvis and Robert Wade, two filmmakers who have both worked on two previous Bond movies. It also talks about how Casino Royale was adapted into a spoof spy movie by John Huston in 1967, with David Niven playing the lead. The text then mentions that producer John Busby axed Martin Campbell after he offered him the chance to return, meaning he wasn't hired for that role anymore.

There are several actors who might take over this role: Dougray Scott, Clive Owen (Owen is an Oscar nominee), and Hugh Jackman. Producers haven't decided yet if someone else will play Bond on film, including Niven. The text also notes that Kill Bill director Quentin Tarantino had talked about wanting to do a Bond project with them and even spoke to Martin Campbell.

 Shooting for Casino Royale starts once Martin Campbell finishes work on "The Legend of Zorro," which stars Catherine Zeta Jones and Antonio Banderas. The film is expected to go out in 2006, but I don't know when it'll actually be released yet.

The text goes into more detail about Fleming's book: it includes a scene where a woman arrives on the scene to take his eye off the game against a Russian spy. It's described as a violent and sadistic story with Niven suffering a brutal beating from Le Chiffre, a figure from the book. The movie is one of Fleming's most intense and emotional works.

Additionally, it mentions that the book was also adapted to TV in 1954 with Barry Nelson playing Jimmy Bond. MGM chairman Chris McGurk praised Martin Campbell as an exciting director, saying they're thrilled about returning to direct the next film and noting that it's a significant update from previous Bond films.

In summary, the key points are: Casino Royale becoming the next Bond movie, directed by Martin Campbell, expected as the 21st film, based on a spoof adaptation of The Mask of Zorro. It will be shot starting with Busby after finishing "The Legend of Zorro," released in 2006. The book itself is an intense, emotional story featuring Niven and Le Chiffre.

 Casino Royale, by Ian Fleming, is set to become the next James Bond film, directed by Martin Campbell. It will be the 21st James Bond film, bringing the franchise closer to its conclusion. Based on a spoof adaptation of The Mask of Zorro, it features a gripping narrative with a focus on Niven and Le Chiffre. Shooting begins after John Busby completes work on "The Legend of Zorro," and production is expected in 2006. The book itself is an intense, emotional story, including a scene with Catherine Zeta Jones and Antonio Banderas, featuring Niven's violent beating from Le Chiffre.
tinyllama:1.1b: Le Casino Royale est prochain film James Bond et les spéculations sont rétrocedant à qui remplira le rôle. Le Casino Royale sera l'octroi d'un huitième acteur, y compris Niens dans le dernier film, avec une nomination en attente pour une version française de Pierce Broshan. L'affaire est déjà entre les mains des producteurs et produiteur exécutif, Quentin Taratino a rencontré Broshan pour paraitre l'adaptation de Casino Royale qui deviendra l'après-film de Zoro, un deuxième film sur le scénario équivalent à The Masque de Zoro. Les scénaristes semblent préparer une nouvelle œuvre pour Robert Waide qui avait déjà travaillé sur deux précédents films du brigeur britannique. Le livre Casino Royale d'Ian Fleming a vu son personnage introduit par un Russe dans le jeu de baçaque, avec simultanéité d'un autre spy arrivant sur le scénario à la place de Bond. L'adaptation est également inspirée pour la télévision en 1954 avec l'acteur Barry Nelson comme James Bond dans la version américaine. Le vice-président de la MGM Chris McGurk a déclaré : "Martin (Campbill) est un véritable éclair. Goldeneye fut une magnifique fiche de jeu et a révélé le révélateur du brigeur britannique. Nous sommes heureux d'envoyer Martin à la direction d'une nouvelle Bond, dans laquelle il aura l'occasion de reprendre son rôle pour diriger un nouveau film". Avec un registre d'écriture de Casino Royale, Campbell vient des Pays-Bas néo-zélandais et a réalisés des films TV comme The Professional, Minder et Bergeraci. Ses films rétrocedant à qui remplira le rôle de James Bond, y compris Niens dans le dernier film, ont déjà été joués par Angelina Joie et Clively Owen.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Casino Royale is the sixth and final book in Ian Fleming's James Bond series. The story is set in the late 1950s, near the end of World War II. British secret agent James Bond must take on a rogue Russian general who has stolen a mysterious document that will trigger an international arms race. The film adaptation will be released in 2006 and will star Pierce Brosnan as James Bond. It's expected to be directed by Martin Campbell, who helmed the previous three Bond films.

Shooting on the film will begin once Campbell finishes The Legend of Zorro in 2006. The script will be developed by Neal Purvis and Robert Wade, who have both worked on previous Bond movies. The novel features intense violence and sadism as Bond suffers a savage beating from his nemesis Le Chiffre. MGM Vice Chairman Chris McGurk is excited to have Campbell return to direct the newest Bond movie, with Goldeneye director Martin Campbell behind the camera.

Filming is expected to begin once the director Martin Campbell finishes work on The Legend of Zorro, a sequel to The Mask of Zorro, starring Catherine Zeta Jones and Antonio Banderas. The script will be developed by Neal Purvis and Robert Wade who have both worked on two previous Bond movies.
